snippet: A class-action lawsuit asks a court to require the Department of Veterans Affairs to reach faster decisions when reconsidering rejected claims.
abstract: Vietnam War veteran Conley Monk Jr files class action lawsuit seeking to force Veterans Affairs Dept to expedite growing backlog of benefits claims appeals, to be filed in the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims; Monk struggled fruitlessly for years to receive claims related to post-traumatic stress disorder and exposure to Agent Orange.
lead_paragraph: A class-action lawsuit asks a court to require the Department of Veterans Affairs to reach faster decisions when reconsidering rejected claims.

headline.main: Vietnam Veteran Files Class-Action Lawsuit Over Delayed Appeals on Disability Benefits
headline.print_headline: Vietnam Veteran Files Class-Action Lawsuit Over Delayed Appeals on Disability Benefits
